N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 1050.5 - Fees for services

State Regulations
(a) Each substance
abuse treatment program funded in whole or in part by the division shall
establish, subject to the approval of the division, a fee schedule for all
substance abuse services not specifically reimbursed by a rate established
pursuant to article 28 of the Public Health Law or title 2 of article 5 of the

Social Services Law. Each program shall charge such fees to all users of its
services who are financially able to pay for those services. Notwithstanding
the foregoing, no substance abuse program shall deny services to any person
because of his inability to pay such fee. (b) At admission, an assessment of each
client's ability to pay for services and eligibility for third party
reimbursement (e.g.,Medicaid, home relief, health insurance) must be made. If a
client is found to be potentially eligible for third party benefits, the
program must aid the client in applying for those benefits. (1)

Programs must document all efforts made
to aid the client in applying for third-party benefits. (2)

Programs must periodically, but not less
than every six months, reassess each client's ability to pay a fee for
treatment. (c) All fees
collected by a recipient of financial support from the division shall be
credited and utilized in accordance with this Part and the terms of the
contract for financial support. Notes
